title: Task 1: Identify a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Does not provide two accurate identifiers for selected work of art
Provides two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art

title: Task 2: Describe visual elements of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not describe the design of Villa Savoye.
Response does accurately describe the design of Villa Savoye.

title: Task 3: Describe visual elements of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not describe the design of the selected work.
Response does accurately describe the design of the selected work.

title: Task 4: Explain how two or more works of art are similar and/or different in how they convey meaning.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific visual evidence from both works to explain one similarity in how the two works were designed to accommodate daily life.
Response does accurately use visual evidence from both works to explain one similarity in how the two works were designed to accommodate daily life.

title: Task 5: Explain how two or more works of art are similar and/or different in how they convey meaning.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific visual evidence from both works to explain one difference in how the two works were designed to accommodate daily life.
Response does accurately use visual evidence from both works to explain one difference in how the two works were designed to accommodate daily life.

title: Task 6: Articulates a defensible claim that explains the meaning or significance of similarities or differences between two works of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not explain one difference in the aesthetic philosophies that the architects expressed in the design of these structures.
Response does accurately explain one difference in the aesthetic philosophies that the architects expressed in the design of these structures.

title: Task 7: Explain how the evidence justifies the claim.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific contextual evidence about Villa Savoye in the explanation.
Response does accurately use specific contextual evidence about Villa Savoye in the explanation.

title: Task 8: Explain how the evidence justifies the claim.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does not use specific contextual evidence about the selected work in the explanation.
Response does accurately use specific contextual evidence about the selected work in the explanation.
